revised_title: Geological and Gravity Anomalies of the Troodos Massif, Cyprus
tldr: The authors investigate the geological features of Cyprus and the source of a large gravity anomaly over the Troodos massif. They propose that the massif evolved as an oceanic volcanic pile and was uplifted during the Alpine orogeny. The high-density rocks causing the gravity anomaly are correlated with the ultrabasic rocks of the Troodos Plutonic Complex, suggesting that they represent upper mantle material.
